Cannot reproduce on Windows 2000. Will have to try on the Mac
*** Bug 47157 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Here are steps that reproduce this on linux-motif:

- drop down the Java perspective's Run toolbar button, select its "Run..." item
- select the Java Application tree item
- press New button below -> creates new child item in tree and selects it
- now re-select the Java Application tree item and will get the next attached 
exception

Created an attachment (id=6896)
log from linux-motif

I looked into this at the debug-ui level because I was investigating whether it 
was an swt problem.  What's happening:

- in my listed steps I click from the newly-created child back to the parent 
item
- this disposes each of the 7 tabs shown on the right, one at a time
- this also disposes the image that was in the tree on the Classpaths tab (see 
JavaClasspathTab.dispose())
- however this tree is not actually disposed, because disposing a TabItem does 
not dispose its children (to do this you have to dispose the TabFolder)
- since this Tree is not disposed, it's fair game for the OS to reference it 
for repaints, etc.  But it contains a disposed Image, hence the error

I should clarify: When I said "disposing a TabItem does not dispose its 
children" I meant "disposing a TabItem does not dispose its contents".  
TabItems do not have actual children, which is why widgets that are to be put 
onto a TabItem have the TabFolder specified as the parent in the constructor.

We have reproduced on Linux motif but have had no luck reproducing on Mac.

Thanks for the explaination Grant.

I do not believe this is critical for M5. Bad yes but the error, from our 
testing, does not have terrible side effects. 

And it will require a bit of restructuring of how the launch configuration 
dialog works to fix.

The side effect is that I have to open the Run... dialog twice before I can 
run a new standalone SWT application.

Because the SWT standalone examples require that location of the swt 
dll/library be specified (-Djava.library.path), I always run a new application 
by using the Run... dialog, copying the VM args from an existing application 
and pasting them into the new application.  As a result of this bug, after I 
create the new entry in the Run... dialog, I have to close the dialog because 
it is unresponsive due to the error then open it again to specify the 
dll/library location.

This error is new in M5.  It did not occur in last weeks integration build.

Nothing in the area of creating/disposing the tab folder has changed in the 
launch dialog in the last week. However, I am invesitgating a fix for M5. Did 
anything change in SWT?

Created an attachment (id=6902)
patch debug ui plug-in

Here's proposed patch (as a plug-in replacement for org.eclipse.debug.ui).
Please try the new plug-in to verify this fixes the problem.

SWT has not changed what happens when items are disposed in a TabFolder.  Will 
try patch.

Marking as fixed. Will update map for M5 build.

Darin (S) please verify fix.
*** Bug 32857 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
